data.title: PART 39
data.text:
Henri de Bourgogne [See PART 4] (Dijon 1066-Astorga, Galicia 1 Nov 1112, bur Braga Cathedral); m.1093/5 Infanta Teresa of Leon and Castile (1070-1 Nov 1130, bur Braga Cathedral); this couple were given what is now Portugal, and in 1093 Henri became Henrique, Conde de Portugal; on his death his widow became Queen of Portugal; they left issue:

1.Affonso Henriquez, b.1094, d.by 1110, bur Braga Cathedral

2.King Affonso I "the Conqueror" of Portugal (Guimaraes 25 Jul 1110-Coimbra 6 Dec 1185, bur there); m.1146 Mafalda (1125-Coimbra 4 Nov 1157, bur there) dau.of Ct Amadeus III of Savoy

2.1.Henrique, b.5 Mar 1147, d.by 1156

2.2.King Sancho I Martino "the Popular" (Coimbra 11 Nov 1154-Coimbra 26 Mar 1212, bur there); m.1175 Dulcia (1160-Coimbra 1 Sep 1198, bur there) dau.of Ct Raimond Berengar IV of Barcelona and Queen Petronille of Aragon

2.2.1.Raimundo, b.ca 1180, d.ca 1189, bur Coimbra

2.2.2.King Affonso II "the Fat" (Coimbra 23 Apr 1185-Coimbra 25 Mar 1223, bur Alcobace); m.1206 Urraca (d.3 Nov 1220, bur Alcobace) dau.of King Alfonso VIII of Castile

2.2.2.1.King Sancho II "the Monk" (8 Nov 1207-Toledo 3 Jan 1248, bur there); m.ca 1246 Mancia (d.1270, bur Najera) dau.of Diegor Lopez de Haro, Cde de Biscaya

2.2.2.2.King Affonso III (Coimbra 5 May 1210-Lisbon 16 Feb 1279, bur Alcobace); m.1st 1235 (div 1253) Matilda, Cts de Boulogne (ca 1202-14 Jan 1262) dau.of Renaud, Cte de Dammartin by Ide de Lorraine, Cts de Boulogne; m.2d 1253 Brites=Beatrix (1242-27 Oct 1303, bur Alcobace) illegitimate dau.of King Alfonso X of Castile

2.2.2.2.1.Roberto, b.1239, d.young

2.2.2.2.2.a son, b.ca 1240, d.young

2.2.2.2.3.Fernando, b.1260, d.Lisbon 1262, bur Alcobace

2.2.2.2.4.King Diniz "the Just"; for his descendants, See PART 40.

2.2.2.2.5.Affonso, sn de Portalegre, etc (Lisbon 8 Feb 1263-Lisbon 2 Nov 1312, bur there); m.ca 1287 Violante=Yolande (1265-Lisbon 1314, bur there) dau.of Juan Manuel de Castilla, Duque de Penafiel y Escalona

2.2.2.2.5.1.Affonso, sn de Leiria (ca 1288-1300)

2.2.2.2.5.2.Maria, b.ca 1290; m.1st Tello III Affonso de Molina, sn de Montalegre (d.1315); m.2d 1315 Fernando de Haro, sn de Ordono

2.2.2.2.5.3.Isabel, sna de Pinella e Miranda, b.ca 1292, d.shortly before 1367; m.Juan el Curvo de Castilla, sn de Biscaya, titular King of Leon (d.1326)

2.2.2.2.5.4.Costanca, b.ca 1294; m.Gonzala Nunez de Lara

2.2.2.2.5.5.Brites, b.ca 1298; m.Pedro Fernandez de Castro, sn de Lemos (d.1343)

2.2.2.2.6.Vicente (1268-Lisbon 1271, bur Alcobace)

2.2.2.2.7.Branca, Vcdsa de Huelgas, Abbess of Lorvano ( Guimaraes 25 Feb 1259-Burgos 17 Apr 1321, bur Huelgas)

2.2.2.2.8.Sancha (2 Feb 1264-Seville 1302, bur Alcobace)

2.2.2.2.9.Maria (21 Nov 1264-Coimbra 6 Jun 1304, bur Alcobace)

2.2.2.2.10.Costança, b.ca 1266, d.Seville before 23 Nov 1271

[illegitimate by Mariana Pirez de Enxara]:

2.2.2.2.11.Fernando Affonso de Portugal, bur Lisbon

2.2.2.2.12.Affonso Diniz de Portugal, d.after 24 Apr 1310; for his descendants, See PART 55.

[illegitimate by Magdalena Gil]:

2.2.2.2.13.Gilles Affonso de Portugal. bur Lisbon

2.2.2.2.13.1.[illegitimate]Lourenco Gilles de Portugal, d.1346, bur Lisbon

2.2.2.2.14.Martim Affonso Chicorro; for his descendants, See PART 56.

[illegitimate by Elvira Estevez]:

2.2.2.2.15.Leonor Affonsa, d.after 1302; m.1st Lisbon 1271 Estevao Annes de Sousa, Chancellor of Portugal (d.1272); m.2d Santarem 1273 Goncalo Garcia de Sousa, Cde de Neiva

[illegitimate by unknown mothers]:

2.2.2.2.16.Rodrigo Affonso de Portugal, a Prior of Santarem, d.there 1302, bur there

2.2.2.2.17.Urraca Affonsa; m.Pedro Annez Gago de Riba de Visello (d.1292)

2.2.2.2.18.Leonor Affonsa, a nun, d.18 Nov 1259

2.2.2.2.19.Urraca Affonsa, a nun at Lorvano, d.1319

2.2.2.2.20.Henrique Affonsa, d.in Palestine; m.Ignez ___

2.2.2.3.Fernando, sn de Serpa e Lamego (1217-19 Jan 1246); m.1242 Sancha, dau.of Fernan Nunez, Cde de Lara

2.2.2.3.1.Leonor, b.ca 1244; m.N, Pr of Dacia

2.2.2.4.Vicente, b.1219, d.young, bur Alcobace

2.2.2.5.Leonor (1211-28 May 1231, bur Ringsted); m.24 Jun 1229 King Waldemar III of Denmark (d.1231)

2.2.2.6.[illegitimate] João Affonso de Portugal, d.9 Oct 1234, bur Alcobace

2.2.3.Pedro, Cde de Urgel, King of Majorca, Pr de Segorbia (Coimbra 23 Feb 1187-Majorca 2 Jun 1258, bur there); m.15 Jul 1229 Arumbaix, Cdsa de Urgel (1180-Aug 1231)

2.2.3.1.[illegitimate] Rodrigo "il Magistro" de Urgel, bur Coimbra

2.2.3.2.[illegitimate] Fernando Pedro de Urgel, bur Coimbra

2.2.4.Fernando (24 Mar 1188-Noyon 4 Mar 1233, bur Marquette nr Lille); m.1 Jan 1212 Css Joanna of Flanders and Hainaut (Valenciennes 1188-Marquette 5 Dec 1244, bur there)

2.2.4.1.Maria, b.ca 1224, d.ca 1236

2.2.5.Henrique, b.1189, d.ca 1191, bur Coimbra

2.2.6.Teresa, beatified 1705; b.ca 1176, d.Lorvano 18 Jun 1250, bur there; m.Guimaraes 15 Feb 1191 (annulled 1198) King Alfonso IX of Castile (d.1230)

2.2.7.Sancha, beatified 1705, first Abbess of Lorvano, b.ca 1178, d.there 13 Mar 1229, bur there

2.2.8.Costança (Coimbra May 1182-Lorvano 3 Aug 1202, bur there)

2.2.9.Branca, a nun (ca 1192-Guadalajara 17 Nov 1240, bur Coimbra)

2.2.10.Berengaria (ca 1194-Ringsted 27 Mar 1221, bur there); m.1213 King Waldemar II of Denmark (d.1241)

2.2.11.Mafalda, beatified 1793 (ca 1197-Arouca 1 May 1257, bur there); m.1215 (div 1216) King Enrique I of Castile (d.1217)

[illegitimate by Maria Ayres de Fornellos, sna de Villanova]:

2.2.12.Martim Sanches de Portugal, Cde de Trastamara, Gov of Leon and Galicia, d.ca 1260; m.Eulalia Perez de Castro, sna de Santa Olahla y Iscar

2.2.13.Urraca Sanches, d.after 1256; m.Lourenco Suarez de Viegas-Villadarez

[Illegitimate by Maria Paez de Ribera, sna de Villa del Conde]:

2.2.14.Nuno Sanches de Portugal, b.before 1174, d.young, bur Coimbra

2.2.15.Gille Sanches de Portugal, d.14 Sep 1236, bur Coimbra; m.Maria Garcia de Sousa

2.2.16.Rodrigo Sanches de Portugal, k.a.Oporto 1245, bur Grijo; m. NN

2.2.16.1.Alfonso Rodriguez, a priest, d.after 1294

2.2.17.Tereza Sanches, d.1230; m.Alfonso Tellez de Menezes d'Alta, sn d'Albuquerque (d.1230)

2.2.18.Costanca "the Pious", a nun (1204-Coimbra 8 Aug 1269, bur there)

2.2.19.Mayor Sanches, a nun, d.Coimbra, bur there

2.3.João, b.ca 1156, d.young

2.4.Mafalda (ca 1149-1173/4); m.ca 1160 King Alfonso II of Aragon (d.1196); this marriage is according to Schwennicke, Band II, Tafel 38; however, in Tafel 70, Alfonso is said to have married only once, to Sancha of Castile

2.5.Urraca (ca 1251-16 Oct 1188); m.1165 (annulled 1175) King Fernando II of Leon and Galicia (d.1188)

2.6.Sancha, b.ca 1153, d.after 1159

2.7.Teresa=Mafalda, sna de Montemayor, el Viejo e Ourem (1157-drowned off Flanders 6 May 1218, bur Clairvaux); m.1st 1183/4 Philippe de Lorraine, Ct of Flanders and Vermandois (d.1191); m.2d Feb 1194 (div 1195) Duc Eudes III de Bourgogne

[the next 5 were illegitimate by unknown mothers]:

2.8.Fernando Affonso, d.after Aug 1172

2.9.Pedro Affonso, a monk, bur Alcobace

2.10.Alfonso Affonso, Grand Master of the Knights of St.John of Jerusalem, d.Santarem 1207, bur there

2.11.Tereza Affonsa, m.1st Sancho Nunez de Barbosa; m.2d Fernando Mendez, sn de Bragança e Chaves

2.12.Urraca Affonsa; m.Pedro Alfonso de Viegas

3.Henrique, b.ca 1106, living 1110, bur Braga Cathedral

4.Urraca, b.ca 1096, d.after 1130; m.before 1120 Bermudo Perez de Trava, Cde de Trastamara

5.Sancha, b.ca 1098, d.by 1129; m.Fernando Mendez, sn de Bragança

6.Teresa, b.ca 1102; m.Sancho Nunez de Barbosa

7.[illegitimate by Elvia Gualtar] Pedro Affonso de Portugal, a monk, Grand Master of the Order of Aviz, friend of Bernard of Clairvaux (ca 1105-9 May 1175)

END OF PART 39.

PART 40.

King Diniz I "the Just" of Portugal (Lisbon 9 Oct 1261-Santarem 7 Jan 1325, bur Odivellas); m.by proxy Barcelona 2 Feb and in person Trancosa 24 Jun 1282 Isabel (canonized 1625) (Saragossa 1271-Estremos 4 Jul 1336, bur Coimbra) dau.of King Pedro III of Aragon. He had issue:

1.King Affonso IV "the Bold" (Lisbon 8 Feb 1291-Lisbon 28 May 1357, bur there); m.Lisbon 12 Sep 1309 Beatriz (Toro 1293-Lisbon 25 Oct 1359, bur there) dau.of King Sancho IV of Castile

1.1.Affonso (Villa de Penella 12 Jan 1315-ibid 1315, bur Santarem)

1.2.Diniz (Santarem 12 Jan 1317-1318, bur Alcobace)

1.3.King Pedro I "the Cruel" (Coimbra 18 Apr 1320-Estremos 18 Jan 1367, bur Alcobace); m.1st Alfayate 1325 (annulled 1330) Blanca (d.Las Huelgas 1375) dau.of Inft Pedro of Castile; m.2dLisbon 24 Aug 1339 Costanza (ca 1323-Santarem 13 Nov 1345, bur there) dau.of Juan Manuel de Castilla, Pr de Villena, Duque de Penafiel y de Escalona; m.3d, secretly in 1346, and openly at Bragança 1 Jan 1354, Inez (ca 1327-murdered at Coimbra 7 Jan 1355, bur Alcobace) illegitimate dau.of Pedro de Castro, sn de Lemos; the children of this 3d marriage were excluded from the succession to the throne, which, ironically, went to their illegitimate brother, João I;

1.3.1.Luiz (Lisbon 27 Feb 1340-Lisbon 6 Mar 1340, bur there)

1.3.2.King Fernando I "the Gentle" (Santarem 31 Oct 1345-Lisbon 29 Oct 1383, bur Santarem); m.Mar 1372 Leonor (d.Tordesillas 27 Apr 1386, bur Cloister Mercedes, nr Valladolid) dau.of Martim Affonso Tellez de Menezes

1.3.2.1.Queen Brites, b.Coimbra 1372, deposed 1383, d.Madrigal after 1409; m.by proxy Salvaterra 30 Apr 1383 and in person Badajoz 14 May 1383 King Juan I of Castile (d.1390)

1.3.2.2.Pedro, b.and d.1380, aged 4 days

1.3.2.3.Affonso, b.and d.1382

1.3.2.4.[illegitimate] Isabel, b.1364, d.Marans, France after 1395; m.Burgos 1373 Alfonso Enriquez, Cde de Gijon y Noronha (d.after 1395)

1.3.3.Maria, b.Evora 6 Apr 1343, d.Aveiro after 1367, bur Santarem; m.Evora 3 Feb 1354 Inft Fernando of Aragon, Marques de Tortosa (d.1363)

1.3.4.Affonso, b.ca 1348, d.young

1.3.5.João, Duque de Valencia de Campos; for his descendants, See PART 53.

1.3.6.Diniz, Duque de Cifuentes y Escalona, titular King of Portugal; for his descendants, See PART 54.

1.3.7.Brites (ca 1347-Ledesma 5 Jul 1381); m.1373 Sancho de castilla, Cde de Albuquerque y de Haro (d.1374)

1.3.8.[illegitimate by Teresa Gille Lourenco] King João I "the False" of Portugal (Lisbon 11 Apr 1358-d.Lisbon of the plague 14 Aug 1433, bur Batalla); m.Oporto 11 Feb 1387 Philippa (Leicester 31 Mar 1360-d.of the plague at Odivellas 19 Jul 1415, bur Batalla) dau.of John, Duke of Lancaster

1.3.8.1.Affonso (Santarem 30 Jul 1390-Braga 22 Dec 1400, bur there)

1.3.8.2.King Duarte; for his descendants, See PART 41

1.3.8.3.Pedro, Duque de Coimbra (Lisbon 9 Dec 1392-k.a.on the banks of the Alfarobeia 20 May 1449, bur Batalla); m.Coimbra 13 Sep 1428 Isabel (1409-1443, bur Batalla) dau.of Jaime de Aragon, Cde de Urgel

1.3.8.3.1.Pedro, pretender to the Aragonese throne (1429-k.a.Granollers 30 Jun 1466, bur Barcelona)

1.3.8.3.2.João, Duque de Coimbra, Pr of Antioch (1431-d.of poisoning by his mother-in-law 7 Oct 1457); m.1456 Queen Charlotte of Cyprus (Nicosia 1442-Rome 16 Jul 1487) dau.of John de Lusignan, King of Cyprus

1.3.8.3.3.Jaime, Cardinal, Archbishop of Lisbon (16 Sep 1434-Florence 15 Apr 1459, bur there)

1.3.8.3.4.Isabella (1432-Evora 2 Dec 1455, bur Batalla); m.6 May 1448 King Affonso V of Portugal (d.1481)

1.3.8.3.5.Brites (1435-Bruges Feb 1462, bur Quesnoy); m.13 May 1453 Adolf of Cleves-Ravenstein (d.1492)

1.3.8.3.6.Filippa, a nun (Coimbra 1437-Odivellas 25 Jul 1497, bur there)

1.3.8.4.Henrique "the Navigator", Duque de Viseu (Oporto 4 Mar 1394-Sagres 13 Nov 1460, bur Batalla)

1.3.8.5.João (Santarem 13 Jan 1400-Alcacer-de-Sal 18 Oct 1442, bur Batalla); m.11 Nov 1424 his niece Isabella (1402-Arevalo 1465, bur Batalla) dau.of Affonso, Duque de Bragança

1.3.8.5.1.Diego (ca 1462, d.1443, bur Batalla

1.3.8.5.2.Isabella (ca 1428-Arevalo 15 Aug 1496, bur Miraflora nr Burgos); m.Madrigalejo Aug 1447 King Juan II of Castile (d.1454)

1.3.8.5.3.Brites (ca 1430-Beja 30 Sep 1506, bur there); m.Alcacovas 16 Mar 1452 Inft Fernando of Portugal, Duque de Viseu (d.1470)

1.3.8.5.4.Filippa, sna de Villa de Almada (ca 1432-ca 1444)

1.3.8.6.Fernando "the Blessed" (Santarem 29 Sep 1402-k.a.Fez 5 Jun 1433, bur Batalla)

1.3.8.7.Branca (Lisbon 13 Jul 1388-Lisbon Mar 1389, bur there)

1.3.8.8.Isabella (Evora 21 Feb 1397-Nieppe 17 Dec 1472, bur Dijon); m.by proxy Lisbon 24 Jul 1429 and in person Bruges Mar 1430 Duc Philippe III de Bourgogne (d.1467)

1.3.8.9.Branca, b.1398, d.young

[illegitimate by Inez Perez Esteves]:

1.3.8.10.Affonso, Duque de Bragança; for his descendants See PART 42.

1.3.8.11.Branca, b.1378, d.young

1.3.8.12.Brites (ca 1386-1438/9); m.1st London 1411 Thomas Fitzalan, Earl of Arundel (d.1415); m.2d 1416 Sir Gilbert Talbot (d.1419)

1.4.João (23 Sep 1326-21 Jun 1327, bur Odivellas)

1.5.Maria (1313-d.of poisoning Evora 18 Jan 1357, bur Seville); m.1328 King Alfonso XI of Castile (d.1350)

1.6.Isabel (21 Dec 1324-11 Jul 1326, bur Coimbra)

1.7.Leonor (1328-Teruel 29 Oct 1348, bur Poblet); m.by proxy Santarem 11 Jun 1347 and in person 15 Nov 1347 King Pedro IV of Aragon (d.1387)

1.8.[illegitimate] Maria; m.Fernando, sn de Valencia de Campos, etc (d.1384)

2.Costança (3 Jan 1290-18 Nov 1313, bur Valladolid); m.Valladolid 23 Jan 1302 King Fernando IV of Castile (d.1312)

[illegitimate by Aldonca Sanchez de Sousa]:

3.Affonso Sanchez de Portugal, Cde de Albuquerque, b.before 1286, k.a.in Castile 1329; m.1304 Tereza, sna de Albuquerque (d.1350, bur nr Braga) dau.of Juan Alfonso de Menezes, sn de Albuquerque, by Tereza Sanchez de Castilla

3.1.Juan Alfonso "the Good" de Portugal, Cde de Albuquerque (ca 1305-d.of poisoning by King Pedro I of Castile autumn 1354); m.Isabel Tellez de Menezes (d.after 1354); Juan Alfonso had no legitimate kids,but had illegitimate kids by Maria Barba

3.1.1.Martim Gil, sn de Albuquerque e Menezes (ca 1325-murdered by King Pedro I of Castile 1365)

3.1.2.Fernando Alfonso d'Albuquerque, sn de Villa Nova de Ancos, Grand Master of the Order of Santiago, b.ca 1327, d.after 1384; he had illegitimate kids by Laura ___:

3.1.2.1.Juana d'Albuquerque; m.Goncalo Vasquez Coutinho, sn do Couto de Leon, Marchal of Portugal

3.1.2.2.Teresa d'Albuquerque; m.Vasco Martins da Cunha, sn de Morgado de Tavoa

3.1.3.Brites d'Albuquerque; m.João Affonso Tellez de Menezes, Cde de Barcellos, Admiral of Portugal (k.a.Aljubarrota 14 Aug 1385)

3.1.4.Maria d'Albuquerque; m.Goncalvo Tellez de Menezes, Cde de Neiva e Faria

3.1.5.Pedro Gil d'Albuquerque

[illegitimate by Gracia, sna de Ribeyra]:

4.Pedro de Portugal, Cde de Barcellos (1287-1354, bur Tarouca; m.1st Branca Peres de Sousa; m.2d Maria Ximenez Coronel (d.1347, bur Xixena); m.3d ca 1348 Tereza Annes de Toledo (d.ca 1350)

4.1.Pedro de Barcellos, bur Tomar

4.2.Maria Ximenes de Barcellos

5.[illegitmate by Maria Pirez] João Affonsa de Portugal, legitimized 1317, sn de Arouca, murdered by King Affonso IV 4 Jun 1336; m.30 Aug 1315 Juana Ponce de Leon

5.1.Urraca Affonsa; m.1335 Alvaro Perez de Guzman, sn de Gibraleon y Olvera

5.2.[illegitimate]Leonor de Arouca; m.Goncalo de Martinez-

Portocarrero

6.[illegitimate by Marina Gomez]Maria Affonsa, living 1340; m.Santarem 1318 Juan Alfonso de la Cerda, sn de Gibraleon, Huelva y Deza (d.1348)

[illegitimate by unknown mothers]:

7.Fernando Sanches de Portugal, d.after 13 Nov 1327, bur Santarem; m.Froila Annes de Briteyros

8.Pedro Affonso de Portugal; m.before 17 Jul 1309 Maria Mendez

9.Maria Affonsa de Portugal, a nun, d.1320, bur Odivellas

END OF PART 40.

Part 41.King Duarte of Portugal (Viseu 31 Oct 1391-Thomar 9 Sep 1438, bur Batalla); m.Coimbra 4 Nov 1428 Leonora (1400-Toledo 19 Feb 1445, bur Batalla) dau.of King Fernando I of Aragon. He had issue:

1.João, b.Lisbon Oct 1429, d.by 1433, bur Batalla

2.King Affonso V (Sintra 15 Jan 1432-d.there of the plague 28 Aug 1481); m.1st 6 May 1448 Isabella (1432-Evora 1455, bur Batalla) dau.of Infant Pedro of Portugal; m.2d Placentia 23/30 May 1475 (div 1479) Juana Bertrandilla (1459-Coimbra 1506, bur there) dau.of King Enrique IV of Castile

2.1.João, b.Sintra 29 Jan 1451, d.by 1455, bur Batalla

2.2.King João II "the Severe" (Lisbon 3 May 1455-Alvora 25 Oct 1495, bur Batalla); m.Setubal 22 Jan 1471 Infta Leonor of Portugal (Beja 1458-Lisbon 1525, bur there)

2.2.1.Affonso (Lisbon 18 May 1475-nr Santarem 13 Jul 1491, bur Batalla); m.by proxy Seville 11 Apr 1490 and in person Estremos 24 Nov 1490 Isabella, Pss of the Asturias (Duenas 2 Oct 1470-Saragossa 24/25 Aug 1498, bur Toledo) dau.of Ferdinand and Isabella of Spain

2.2.2.João, b.and d.Feb/Mar 1483

2.2.3.Jorge de Lancastre, Duque de Coimbra; for his descendants See PART 50

2.3.Joana, Regent of Portugal 1471/5; beatified 1693 (Lisbon 6 Feb 1452-Aveiro 12 May 1490)

3.Fernando, Duque de Beja, de Salvaterra e de Viseu (Almeirim 17 Nov 1433-Setubal 18 Sep 1470, bur Beja); m.Alcocavas 16 Mar 1452 Brites (1430-Beja 1506, bur there) dau.of Inft João of Portugal

3.1.João, Duque de Beja e de Viseu (ca 1456-1483)

3.2.Diego, Duque de Beja e de Viseu (1460-stabbed to death at Setubal 23 Aug 1484, bur Batalla)

3.2.1.[illegitimate] Alfosno, legitimized, Duque de Viseu (ca 1484-Oct 1504); m.2 Jun 1500 Joana de Noronha

3.2.1.1.Brites de Portugal-Lara Marquesa de Villa-Real, b.ca 1503, d.after 1520; m.Dec 1519 Pedro de Menezes Marques de Villa-Real, etc

3.3.Duarte, b.1462, d.young

3.4.Diniz, b.1464, d.young, bur Beja

3.5.Simiao, b.1467, d.young, bur Beja

3.6.Affonso, b.1468, d.young

3.7.King Manoel I of Portugal (Alcocheta 1 Jun 1469-d.Lisbon of the plague 13 Dec 1521, bur Belem); m.1st Valencia d'Alcantara Oct 1497 Isabella, Pss of the Asturias (Duenas 1470-Saragossa 1498, bur Toledo) dau.of Ferdinand and Isabella of Spain; m.2d by proxy Lisbon 24 Aug 1500 and in person Alcacer-de-Sal 30 Oct 1500 Maria (Cordoba 29 Jun 1482-Lisbon 7 Mar 1517, bur Belem) sister of his 1st wife; m.3d Crato 24 Nov 1518 and Lisbon 7 Mar 1519 Eleonore (Brussels 15 Nov 1498-Talavera 18 Feb 1558, bur Escorial) dau.of King Felipe I of Spain

3.7.1.Miguel da Paz, Pr of Portugal, Pr of the Asturias [as heir presumptive to Spain] (Saragossa 23 Aug 1498-Granada 19 Jul 1500, bur Saragossa)

3.7.2.King João III (Lisbon 6 Jun 1502-Lisbon 11 Jun 1557, bur Belem); m.Salamanca 5 Feb 1525 Catalina (Torquemada 14 Jan 1507-Lisbon 12 Feb 1578, bur Belem) dau.of King Felipe II of Spain

3.7.2.1.Affonso (Almeria 24 Feb 1526-Mar/Apr 1526, bur Belem)

3.7.2.2.Manoel (Alvito 1 Nov 1531-Evora 14 Apr 1537, bur Belem)

3.7.2.3.Filippe (Evora 25 May 1533-Evora 29 Apr 1539, bur Belem)

3.7.2.4.Diniz (Evora 26 Apr 1535-Evora 1 Jan 1539, bur Belem)

3.7.2.5.João (Evora 3 Jun 1537-Lisbon 2 Jan 1554, bur Belem); m. Toro 7 Dec 1552 Juana (Madrid 27 Jun 1537-Escorial 7 Sep 1573, bur Madrid) dau.of Emperor Charles V

3.7.2.5.1.King Sebastião (20 Jan Lisbon 1554-k.a.in a naval battle nr Alcacer 4 Aug 1578, bur Belem)

3.7.2.6.Antonio (Lisbon 9 Mar 1539-Lisbon 20 Jan 1540, bur Belem)

3.7.2.7.Maria (Coimbra 15 Oct 1527-Valladolid 12 Jul 1545, bur Escorial); m.Almeria 15 Nov 1543 King Felipe II of Spain (d.1598)

3.7.2.8.Isabella (Lisbon 28 Apr 1529-1530, bur Belem)

3.7.2.9.Brites (Lisbon 15 Feb 1530-1530, bur Belem)

3.7.2.10.[illegitimate by Isabel Muniz] Manoel de Portugal, d.young

3.7.2.11.[illegitimate by Isabel Muniz] Duarte de Portugal, Archbishop of Braga and Evora (1521-Lisbon 11 Nov 1543)

3.7.3.Luiz, Duque de Beja (Abrantes 3 Mar 1506-Quinta de Marvilla 27 Nov 1555, bur Belem); he had an illegitimate son by Violanta "la Pelicana" Gomez, born a Jew, d.as a nun at Almorta:

3.7.3.1.Antonio de Portugal; recognized by England and other powers as King of Portugal in 1580; he and his descendants, known as "the Portuguese Princes", were political pawns for the next few decades as Spain conquered Portugal and the powers threatened to restore these princes. For his descendants, See PART 49.
